channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Can Europe’s New Military Spending Help Its Economies?
item.description: The continent’s leaders hope a surge of investment, to fill a security void left by the United States, can ignite growth. It won’t be easy.

item.title: Germany’s Siemens to cut over 6,000 jobs globally—with half the roles lost in home market
item.description: The reductions will mostly be made in the group's factory automation unit while a small number of positions will be lost in its electric vehicle charg...

item.title: Turkey Arrests Istanbul Mayor, Key Rival to President Erdogan
item.description: Ekrem Imamoglu was detained at his home, according to prosecutors, who said the charges against him were related to corruption and terrorism.

item.title: Judge Moves to Limit Musk’s Power, and a Social Security Shake-Up
item.description: Plus, the tale of a stolen golden toilet.

item.title: Energy Infrastructure Attacks Have Inflicted Pain on Both Russia and Ukraine
item.description: An agreement to suspend attacks against energy infrastructure would halt a strategy employed by Ukraine and Russia. Kyiv has tried to hit at Russian o...

item.title: Canada buys Australian radar system as Europe and America’s northern neighbor eye weaning themselves off U.S. military gear
item.description: Questions are mounting in Canada and in Europe over whether big-ticket purchases of high-end U.S. weaponry are still a wise strategic choice.

item.title: Defiance and Threats in Deportation Case Renew Fear of Constitutional Crisis
item.description: Legal scholars say that the nation has reached a tipping point and that the right question is not whether there is a crisis, but rather how much damag...

item.title: ‘47 Ronin’ director arrested on charges of swindling Netflix out of $11 million he used on crypto, a fleet of Rolls-Royces and a Ferrari
item.description: Prosecutors said Netflix had initially paid about $44 million to purchase an unfinished show called “White Horse" from Carl Erik Rinsch, but eventuall...

item.title: Nvidia: AI will need more computing power, not less
item.description: Also: Putin agrees to partial ceasefire, powerful legal team to go after Boeing.

item.title: Tesla owners turn to ‘I bought this before we knew Elon was crazy’ bumper stickers to avoid spike in vehicle torchings
item.description: Attacks on property carrying the logo of Elon Musk's electric-car company are cropping up across the U.S. and overseas.

item.title: Israelis Take to Streets Day After Strikes on Gaza
item.description: Israeli protests are converging over national security and domestic politics amid concerns about the government’s renewed push to reduce the power of ...

item.description: An agreement to suspend attacks against energy infrastructure would halt a strategy employed by Ukraine and Russia. Kyiv has tried to hit at Russian o...

item.title: In Call With Trump, Putin Concedes Little on Ukraine
item.description: Although much of what Vladimir V. Putin agreed to during his call with President Trump was spun as a concession, the Russian leader stuck to the posit...

item.title: Turkey Arrests Istanbul Mayor, Key Rival to President Erdogan
item.description: Ekrem Imamoglu was detained at his home, according to prosecutors, who said the charges against him were related to corruption and terrorism.

item.title: Can Europe’s New Military Spending Help Its Economies?
item.description: The continent’s leaders hope a surge of investment, to fill a security void left by the United States, can ignite growth. It won’t be easy.
